alert.note: Alert for Bay; Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, Bay, Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa Beach, Eglin Air Force Base, Freeport, Ebro, Bunker, Port Washington, Seagrove Beach, Seaside, Grayton Beach, Bruce, Inlet Beach, Seminole Hills, Pine Log, Blue Mountain Beach, Laird and Portland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
